metadata.structure: domain > artist > {quotes, philosophy, technique, lunar, inspirations}

quotes: I paint self-portraits because I am so often alone, because I am the person I know best.
They thought I was a Surrealist, but I wasn't. I never painted dreams. I painted my own reality.
I am not sick. I am broken. But I am happy to be alive as long as I can paint.
I paint flowers so they will not die.
Nothing is worth more than laughter. It is strength to laugh and to abandon oneself, to be light.
Frida Kahlo.philosophy: Painted personal reality, not dreams. Art as survival and self-expression through pain.
Frida Kahlo.technique: Self-portraits with symbolic elements. Influenced by Mexican folk art and ex-voto tradition.

lunar.quote: You deserve a love that makes you feel safe, able to get the moon when it walks by your side.
lunar.symbolism: Moon represents womanhood and strength. In 'Tree of Hope' the moon side shows healing vs sun's sacrifice.

quotes: I found I could say things with color and shapes that I couldn't say any other way - things I had no words for.
When you take a flower in your hand and really look at it, it's your world for the moment.
I decided that if I could paint that flower in a huge scale, you could not ignore its beauty.
To me they are strangely more living than the animals walking around.
To create one's world in any of the arts takes courage.
Georgia O'Keeffe.philosophy: Making the small seem large and the large small. Stripping to essential geometry.
Georgia O'Keeffe.technique: Compressed, concise, reductive style. Color as primary expression of inner life.

quotes: I don't think about art when I'm working. I try to think about life.
I want to make paintings that look as if they were made by a child.
I am not a black artist, I am an artist.
I don't listen to what art critics say. I don't know anybody who needs a critic to find out what art is.
Jean-Michel Basquiat.philosophy: Art as life distillation. Themes: race, class, power, identity, mortality.
Jean-Michel Basquiat.technique: Neo-Expressionist. Raw brushwork, symbols, text fragments. Influenced by jazz, African art, anatomy, comics.

quotes: Color is the keyboard, the eyes are the hammers, the soul is the piano with many strings.
The more abstract is form, the more clear and direct its appeal.
The artist must train not only his eye but also his soul.
All methods are sacred if they are internally necessary.
Vasily Kandinsky.philosophy: Art as spiritual practice. Inner necessity drives creation. Synesthesia between color and music.
Vasily Kandinsky.technique: Abstract expressionism. Color as direct soul communication.

lunar.quote: The deeper the blue becomes, the more strongly it calls man towards the infinite.
lunar.symbolism: Blue associated with night, infinite, supernatural calling.

quotes: The Moon, like a flower in Heaven's high bower, with silent delight, sits and smiles on the night.
To see a World in a Grain of Sand, And a Heaven in a Wild Flower.
No bird soars too high if he soars with his own wings.
William Blake.philosophy: Visionary artist-poet. Imagination as divine sight.
William Blake.technique: Illuminated printing. Poetry integrated with visual art.

lunar.quote: The Moon, like a flower in Heaven's high bower, with silent delight, sits and smiles on the night.
lunar.symbolism: Moon as celestial flower, silent witness to night.

quotes: The value of art is in the observer.
I paint with my back to the world.
The freer the soul, the more abstract painting becomes.
Agnes Martin.philosophy: Minimalist transcendence. Art as meditation. Zen-influenced approach to painting.
Agnes Martin.technique: Grid-based compositions. Subtle color fields. Hand-drawn lines for human imperfection.

quotes: Seeing is no longer believing. The very notion of truth has been put into crisis.
Making art is about objectifying your experience of the world, transforming the flow of moments into something visual.
I think pictures and words have the power to make us rich or poor.
I really resist categories - that naming is a closing down of meaning.
I think that art is still a site for resistance.
Barbara Kruger.philosophy: Art as commentary. Using advertising language to critique consumer culture and power structures.
Barbara Kruger.technique: Futura Bold typeface over red backgrounds. Found images with confrontational text overlays.
Barbara Kruger.inspirations: Learned craft as magazine designer at Conde Nast. Studied under Diane Arbus at Parsons.

quotes: People are told 'This is the right way to do it, these are expectations, these are the rules'. But when 'Obey' confronts you it makes people question.
I've never really considered myself just a street artist. I consider myself a populist.
Skateboarding itself requires creative adaptation to the streets and obstacles.
Being complicit because it's the home team is nationalism, not patriotism.
Shepard Fairey.philosophy: Phenomenology through street art. Reawakening wonder about one's environment. Questioning obedience and authority.
Shepard Fairey.technique: Stencil art, stylized iconic imagery. Influenced by Russian Constructivism and propaganda art.
Shepard Fairey.inspirations: Barbara Kruger's style, John Carpenter's 'They Live', Dead Kennedys, George Orwell.

quotes: In our life there is a single color, as on an artist's palette, which provides the meaning of life and art. It is the color of love.
Color is all. When color is right, form is right. Color is vibration like music.
If I create from the heart, nearly everything works; if from the head, almost nothing.
Art seems to me to be a state of soul more than anything else.
All our interior world is reality, and that, perhaps, more so than our apparent world.
The dignity of the artist lies in keeping awake the sense of wonder in the world.
Marc Chagall.philosophy: Art as love expression. Interior world as true reality. Maintaining wonder.
Marc Chagall.technique: Dreamlike symbolism. Color as vibration. Fusion of personal mythology with folk traditions.

quotes: Art does not reproduce the visible but makes it visible.
Color possesses me. I don't have to pursue it. It will possess me always.
Color is the place where our brain and the universe meet.
Drawing is the art of taking a line for a walk.
One eye sees, the other feels.
There is no substitute for intuition.
Paul Klee.philosophy: All the things an artist must be: poet, explorer of nature, philosopher. Making invisible visible.
Paul Klee.technique: Bauhaus master. Color theory based on Goethe's wheel transformed to sphere. Teaching foundations before color.
Paul Klee.inspirations: Trip to Tunisia 1914 sparked breakthrough. Known as 'the magician' at Bauhaus.

quotes: Study the science of art. Study the art of science. Develop your senses - especially learn how to see.
Realize that everything connects to everything else.
Painting is poetry that is seen rather than felt, and poetry is painting that is felt rather than seen.
Where the spirit does not work with the hand, there is no art.
Knowing is not enough; we must apply. Being willing is not enough; we must do.
Nature is the source of all true knowledge.
Leonardo da Vinci.philosophy: Art-science unity. Complete mind development. Everything is interconnected.
Leonardo da Vinci.technique: Sfumato, anatomical precision, scientific observation integrated with artistic expression.

quotes: I paint what cannot be photographed, that which comes from the imagination or from dreams.
I photograph the things that I do not wish to paint, the things which already have an existence.
It has never been my object to record my dreams, just the determination to realise them.
Personally, I have always preferred inspiration to information.
I do not photograph nature. I photograph my visions.
Man Ray.philosophy: Paint dreams, photograph reality. Deliberate rule-breaking. Pure Dadaism through accident.
Man Ray.technique: Invented rayographs (cameraless photography). Reinvented solarization with Lee Miller.

quotes: Void is really a state within. I find myself coming back to narrative without storytelling.
I am interested in making objects that slow time down, that make you sit still and think.
I wish to make sculpture about belief, about passion, about experience: that is outside of material concerns.
There's the pigment language, the void language, the mirror language, the wax language.
I don't want to do what I did before, I want to do what I just don't know how to do.
Anish Kapoor.philosophy: Void as pregnant emptiness, generative potential. Approaching psychology, fear, death, love directly.
Anish Kapoor.technique: Multiple artistic languages: pigment, void, mirror, wax. Scale as sculptural tool.
Anish Kapoor.inspirations: Hindu cosmology concepts of shunya (emptiness) and ananta (infinity). Ritual objects in India.

quotes: I like art as thought better than art as work. Art is thought.
One might not think of light as a matter of fact, but I do. And it is, as plain and open and direct an art as you will ever find.
The fewer parts the better, because with fewer parts you can more surely grasp the whole.
I try never to acknowledge 'isms' on art because of their usual unanimous inaccuracy.
Dan Flavin.philosophy: Art as thought, not work. Vehemently 'Maximalist' while classified as Minimalist.
Dan Flavin.technique: Commercial fluorescent tubes. Light 'propositions' not sculptures. Space redefinition.
Dan Flavin.inspirations: Marcel Duchamp's readymades. Seminary education influenced spiritual dimension of light work.

quotes: My career has been about navigating these two extremes - the political and the aesthetic.
You look at landscape, but it's not really landscape, it's a symbol for our country, it's a metaphor.
The desert epitomizes the extremes of the human condition.
I've come to believe that beauty can be a very powerful conveyor of difficult ideas.
Whatever else a photograph may be about, it is always about time.
Richard Misrach.philosophy: Landscape as metaphor for human condition. Beauty as tool for difficult truths. Bearing witness.
Richard Misrach.technique: Large format color photography. Pioneer of fine art color work. Desert Cantos as magnum opus.

quotes: The world is in color. And there's nothing we can do about that.
I have this discipline of treating everything equally - I used to say 'democratically'.
I am at war with the obvious.
I only ever take one picture of one thing. Literally. Never two.
I think I could really photograph blind if I had to.
William Eggleston.philosophy: Democratic approach - all subjects equal. War with the obvious. Intuitive over calculated.
William Eggleston.technique: Pioneered dye-transfer printing in fine art. Shot without viewfinder. One shot discipline.
William Eggleston.inspirations: Influenced Coen brothers, Sofia Coppola, David Lynch. First solo color show at MoMA 1976.

quotes: I like contrasting everyday problems with death; it takes away their power for a moment.
Dystopia creeps in further every day, it's hard not to talk about it.
XCOPY.philosophy: Death, dystopia, and apathy through distorted visual loops. CC0 licensing as artistic gesture.
XCOPY.technique: Animated GIFs, complex layering, glitch effects. Bright colors with dark themes.
XCOPY.inspirations: Counter-culture: punk, anarchism, horror. Pioneer in NFT/crypto art space since 2018.

quotes: You're not really bidding on what you're seeing - you're bidding on future experiences.
My artistic philosophy is that these works of art are going to be reinterpreted in the future like pieces of music.
Art is best when it encompasses the totality of an artist's life, experiences, and abilities.
The roadmap of the living artist is the living artist.
NFTs are a technology that solves lots of problems that have existed in the established art world.
Matt Kane.philosophy: Art as database for future reinterpretation. 15,000+ hours of custom coding. Work ethic from traditional painting applied to digital.
Matt Kane.technique: Hand-coded generative software. Combines tireless traditional attitude with generative capabilities of code.
Matt Kane.inspirations: Advocated for artist royalty standards in NFT space. First $100K+ NFT artwork on Async Art.

quotes: When I began working exclusively in greyscale is when everything seemed to start to make sense.
I love working with found imagery because it's preloaded. I want to do as little as possible while making it as much mine as possible.
My practice has always been a reflection of myself, my internal cosmology.
It is universal because we're all going through this - we all break ourselves down and build ourselves up from the rubble.
I'm someone who takes in information from the world and regurgitates it in order to create this dark, void mirror of it.
Jesse Draxler.philosophy: Art as self-reflection and internal cosmology. Transformation through identity. Dark mirror of the world.
Jesse Draxler.technique: Greyscale collage. Subversion of found imagery. Trial and error process.
Jesse Draxler.inspirations: Formative years filled with tragedy shaped his dark aesthetic. Philosophy, fiction, and graphic novels.

quotes: My work is rooted in femininity and the female form.
I've always gravitated towards making really colorful artwork.
Color holds so much meaning, which is why I love using different color combinations.
My proudest moment is the day I decided to quit my full-time job and work fully for myself.
My aim with colour is to leverage it to tell a specific story or evoke a particular emotion.
Amber Vittoria.philosophy: Breaking societal expectations on women through color. Femininity and the female form.
Amber Vittoria.technique: Aqueous rainbow gradients. Ink and acrylic with graphite line drawings.
Amber Vittoria.inspirations: Color inspiration from nature - national parks, sunsets, flowers. Mother and grandmother.

quotes: In my practice as an artist, I challenge conventional notions of value and identity.
From the moment we're born, society tries to ascribe value to us.
This seems to me the purest form of art - it's the idea, without the baggage of a vessel.
I use proxies as emotional distillates.
Kevin Abosch.philosophy: Challenging conventional notions of value and identity. Commodification of self. Art without physical form.
Kevin Abosch.technique: Cryptography, blockchain, deep-learning as artistic methods. Proxies and tokens as art.
Kevin Abosch.inspirations: Using blockchain since 2012. Forever Rose sold for $1M. Collaborated with Ai Weiwei.

quotes: I replace Andy's male homosexual desire with my own specificity - Jew love, female voice, and blatant lesbian diva worship.
First I learned their language, and then I dismantled it.
I didn't ask for membership, I demanded it.
A woman has no place in the art world unless she proves over and over again that she won't be eliminated.
Deborah Kass.philosophy: Feminist reappropriation of male art canon. Creating alternate canon celebrating female achievement.
Deborah Kass.technique: Appropriation of Warhol's silkscreen style with feminist and Jewish identity.
Deborah Kass.inspirations: Decade of Warhol series. Jewish Jackie series with Barbra Streisand.

quotes: It's not us versus the machines, rather, it's us with the machines.
My machines have grown beyond being simple assistants and are now effectively augmenting my own creativity.
Attempting to teach my machines how to paint has forced me to reverse engineer my own creative process.
Art uses a lot of creativity, but art is one person communicating with another person.
100% of them are my art, even though the machine made every aesthetic decision and brushstroke.
Pindar Van Arman.philosophy: Human-machine collaboration. Self-discovery through teaching robots. Creativity can be coded.
Pindar Van Arman.technique: Deep learning neural networks, feedback loops, robotic painting arms.
Pindar Van Arman.inspirations: 20+ years in AI art. Cloud Painter robot. Background in DARPA robotics.

quotes: I find it surreal and exhilarating to be a poet who writes not just poems, but poets.
I like to think that the AI-powered muse will help us compose poems we can't yet write.
Repetition is really characterizing poetic language - it's about patterns and recursion.
The thing I think is so interesting is that we're constantly asking how AI replicates creativity. But why would we expect it to replicate anything?
Sasha Stiles.philosophy: What does it mean to be human in a more-than-human age? Poetry as technology. AI as creative collaborator.
Sasha Stiles.technique: Technelegy - AI-powered text generators fine-tuned on her own writing. Poetry mentor to android BINA48.
Sasha Stiles.inspirations: Harvard and Oxford graduate. Co-founder of theVERSEverse. Prix Ars Electronica honored.

quotes: My best work is made when I am playing with it.
The power of using a blockchain was unbelievable to me until I tried it.
I have found some very surprising visualizations in using randomness as it is a central construct in machine learning and artificial intelligence.
Build on what you know already and be willing to experiment with something new.
BÃ¥rd Ionson.philosophy: Technology is changing the human mind in ways we don't understand. Exploring hyperreality - how technology transforms perception of the real. Art should be fun.
BÃ¥rd Ionson.technique: Scanography, oscilloscopes, broken technology, AI, glitch techniques. Randomness as central construct.
BÃ¥rd Ionson.inspirations: Nam June Paik, Jean Baudrillard, Georgia O'Keeffe, John Cage, Robbie Barrat. Works in Centre Pompidou and Oxford Bodleian.

quotes: When you're using code to mimic something that's deeply material and deeply textural, I think that's pretty fascinating.
I really hope that generative art will land in a place one day where it's taught in the art history books.
Let your imagination run free - whether you find in these pieces dragons, ocean waves, birds, or flames.
Emily Xie.philosophy: Interplay between organic and systematic. Balance of chance vs control, abstract vs representational. Code as digital loom.
Emily Xie.technique: Javascript and p5.js. Rapid prototyping in Photoshop/Procreate before coding. Generative algorithms creating new materiality.
Emily Xie.inspirations: Traditional East Asian art. Memories of Qilin references mythological shape-shifting beast. Mother helped name the project.

quotes: We are the Ancients of a Future civilization.
I'm a sculptor with light on videotape.
I want to create multi-fractal parallel dimensions.
I feel as a Millennial that I'm part of this generational cohort having had an analog childhood and now living a digital future.
Sarah Zucker.philosophy: Digital-analog hybrid. Work is about time more than anything. Through play with obsolete tools, speak to eternal human themes.
Sarah Zucker.technique: VideoPainting technique. Analog feedback, VHS manipulation, video synthesis. GIFs viewed 6 billion+ times on Giphy.
Sarah Zucker.inspirations: Crypto art pioneer since 2019. Featured in Sotheby's Natively Digital, Buffalo AKG Museum, Taschen's On NFTs.

quotes: My music is the spiritual expression of what I am - my faith, my knowledge, my being.
I want to speak to their souls.
All a musician can do is to get closer to the sources of nature.
I'd like to be a saint.
John Coltrane.philosophy: Music as spiritual practice. Force for good against suffering.
John Coltrane.technique: 10-12 hours daily practice. Tone inseparable from message.

lunar.note: A Love Supreme recorded with spiritual awakening themes of transcendence.

quotes: Truth will never start out popular in a world more concerned with marketability than righteousness.
We can't plan life. All we can do is be available for it.
Reality is easy. It's deception that's the hard work.
Every time I got hurt, every time I was disappointed, every time I learned, I just wrote a song.
Lauryn Hill.philosophy: Music as truth-telling. Poet, philosopher, voice for change.
Lauryn Hill.technique: Pioneer of fusing rap and singing. Live instrumentation over beats.

quotes: Being honest is my job. That's what music is for me.
The music business is motivated by money. Music is motivated by energy and feelings.
I was born to make mistakes, not to fake perfection.
I'm an artist, and I'm sensitive about my shit.
Hopefully my music is medicine, some type of antidote.
I consider my musical ability to be a gift from the Creator.
Following your heart also means eliminating the things that no longer evolve you.
Peace and Blessings manifest with every lesson learned.
Erykah Badu.philosophy: Music as medicine. Higher self connection. Vibrational awareness.
Erykah Badu.technique: Neo-soul pioneer. Eclectic musical influences. Soulful introspection.
Erykah Badu.inspirations: Queen of Neo-Soul. Explores love, identity, spirituality, social consciousness.

quotes: One good thing about music, when it hits you, you feel no pain.
One love, one heart, let's get together and feel alright.
Emancipate yourself from mental slavery, none but ourselves can free our mind.
Don't gain the world and lose your soul; wisdom is better than silver or gold.
People want to listen to a message, word from Jah. I am not a leader. Messenger.
Bob Marley.philosophy: Universal love transcending borders. Music as prayer. Mental emancipation.
Bob Marley.technique: Reggae as spiritual vehicle. Roots music with global message.

quotes: The music is not in the notes, but in the silence between.
Neither a lofty degree of intelligence nor imagination go to the making of genius. Love, love, love, that is the soul of genius.
Mozart.philosophy: Music as divine gift. Genius through love. Silence as essential as notes.
Mozart.technique: Classical composition. Prodigious output across all forms.

quotes: Music is a higher revelation than all wisdom and philosophy.
Music is the electrical soil in which the spirit lives, thinks and invents.
Don't only practice your art, but force your way into its secrets; art deserves that.
I want to seize fate by the throat.
What you are, you are by accident of birth; what I am, I am by myself.
Beethoven.philosophy: Music as higher revelation. Art as path to the Divine. Self-determination.
Beethoven.technique: Classical to Romantic bridge. Composed through deafness.

quotes: There is no such thing as an empty space or an empty time. There is always something to see, something to hear.
There's no such thing as silence.
The material of music is sound and silence. Integrating these is composing.
The highest purpose is to have no purpose at all. This puts one in accordance with nature.
I can't understand why people are frightened of new ideas. I'm frightened of the old ones.
I gave up making choices. In their place I put the asking of questions.
John Cage.philosophy: No silence exists. Highest purpose is purposelessness. Chance operations.
John Cage.technique: Indeterminate music. 4'33" silence piece. I Ching-based composition.

quotes: I've learned that there's a creative solution to almost any problem.
Music is another planet.
Philip Glass.philosophy: Minimalism as expansion. Repetition creates depth.
Philip Glass.technique: Minimalist composition. Repetitive structures, additive process.

quotes: Flamenco is the most honest and visceral music. You have to be sincere when you sing it.
I think of any genre as a snow globe - you don't admire it for its stillness. You have to shake it up.
I sing flamenco from my perspective. It is absolutely necessary for me to play in my own way.
The flamenco cantes are my foundation. Without flamenco, my music wouldn't make sense.
No music is completely original. The key is in the context.
My favorite flamenco singers are not trying to look pretty. They're trying to put truth in what they do.
Rosalia.philosophy: Sincerity essential. Shaking up tradition. Truth over beauty.
Rosalia.technique: Master's degree in flamenco interpretation. Fusion of tradition with contemporary production.

quotes: The first church is nature. That's the first thing I ever trusted spiritually.
We stumble, and then we have to figure a way out. That's why we need our creativity.
Most of the world uses music as a way to pray. I think it's natural and organic.
'Quirky' has always bothered me - it seems dismissive of people being more themselves than not.
My guiding light is that I come from the heart. The work has to be right, and I come second to the work.
Jane Siberry.philosophy: Nature as first church. Music as prayer. Trust in the creative process.
Jane Siberry.technique: Weaving individual, collective, and spiritual themes. Work takes precedence over self.

quotes: Shadow work is the art of making the unconscious, conscious and the unacceptable, acceptable.
The more aware you are of your shadow, the more embodied you are as a conscious being.
Like a ghost, your shadow will follow you to the ends of the earth begging for the light of consciousness.
Positive focus works on everything except for the things you're trying to use positive focus to avoid.
Teal Swan.philosophy: Integration of shadow self. Consciousness as light.
Teal Swan.technique: Shadow work exercises. Making unconscious conscious.

lunar.note: Shadow work relates to lunar/dark aspects of psyche requiring integration.

Ricardo Cervantes (El Gorila).philosophy: Educational and spiritual guidance at sacred sites.
Ricardo Cervantes (El Gorila).technique: Temazcal ceremonies, medicine walks, cave meditation.

lunar.note: Pyramid of the Moon at Teotihuacan is central to his teaching location.

quotes: Three things cannot be long hidden: the sun, the moon, and the truth.
The mind is everything. What you think you become.
Buddha.philosophy: Enlightenment through awareness. End of suffering.

lunar.quote: Three things cannot be long hidden: the sun, the moon, and the truth.
lunar.symbolism: Moon as symbol of truth that cannot be concealed.

quotes: The universe does not know whether the vibration you're offering is because of something you're observing or imagining. It just receives the vibration and answers it.
The universe is not punishing you or blessing you. The universe is simply responding to the vibrational attitude you are emitting.
As you think, you vibrate. And it is your vibrational offering that equals your point of attraction.
Never mind what is. Imagine it the way you want it to be.
The basis of your life is absolute freedom, the goal is joy.
Abraham Hicks.philosophy: Law of Attraction. Vibrational matching. Science of Deliberate Creation.
Abraham Hicks.technique: Alignment with source. Art of Allowing. Emotional guidance system.

quotes: God bless you all, today, tomorrow and always. Mucho, mucho, mucho amor.
There is no obstacle too great, no dream too big for those who believe.
You have to be nice to people, you have to give the best of yourself every moment.
Walter Mercado.philosophy: Interfaith religion combining Buddhism, Hinduism, Christianity with astrology. Self-love and acceptance.
Walter Mercado.technique: Astrological readings with spiritual upliftment. Messages of peace and love.
Walter Mercado.inspirations: Messenger of the Age of Aquarius. Changed name to Shanti Ananda (peace happiness).

quotes: An equation has no meaning for me unless it expresses a thought of GOD.
While asleep, I had an unusual experience. I saw the goddess Namagiri, and she showed me mathematical proofs.
Srinivasa Ramanujan.philosophy: Mathematics as divine revelation. Intuition over proof.
Srinivasa Ramanujan.technique: Pattern recognition through dreams. Empirical induction.

lunar.note: Received mathematical insights through dreams - nocturnal revelation.

quotes: Imagination is more important than knowledge.
The most beautiful thing we can experience is the mysterious.
Albert Einstein.philosophy: Block universe. Relativity of time and space.
Albert Einstein.technique: Thought experiments. Visualization of abstract concepts.

quotes: Science + Heart + Spirituality as unified framework.
Robert Edward Grant.philosophy: Energy mathematics. Sacred geometry in nature.

quotes: For 97 percent of all Wikipedia articles, if you click the first link repeatedly, you will eventually get to philosophy.
Philosophy is where our knowledge ends.
If your belief conflicts with empirically confirmed knowledge, then you are not seeking meaning; you are delusional.
Besides keeping us honest, math is the most economical and unambiguous terminology we know of.
Sabine Hossenfelder.philosophy: Science has limits. Existential physics enriches dialogue with new insights.
Sabine Hossenfelder.technique: Physics applied to existential questions. Science communication.
Sabine Hossenfelder.inspirations: Author of 'Lost in Math' and 'Existential Physics'. Fearless honesty in science.

quotes: Finally we shall place the Sun himself at the center of the Universe.
To know that we know what we know, and to know that we do not know what we do not know, that is true knowledge.
To know the mighty works of God, to appreciate the wonderful workings of His laws, surely must be a pleasing mode of worship.
In the midst of all dwells the Sun. For who could set this luminary in another or better place.
Nicolaus Copernicus.philosophy: Heliocentric universe. True knowledge acknowledges its limits.
Nicolaus Copernicus.technique: Mathematical astronomy. Challenging established paradigms through observation.

quotes: Darkness cannot drive out darkness; only light can do that.
The time is always right to do what is right.
Injustice anywhere is a threat to justice everywhere.
Martin Luther King Jr..philosophy: Nonviolent resistance. Moral arc of universe.

lunar.quote: Darkness cannot drive out darkness; only light can do that.
lunar.symbolism: Light/darkness duality - moon as light in darkness.

quotes: When you want something, all the universe conspires in helping you to achieve it.
The secret of life is to fall seven times and to get up eight times.
Paul Coelho.philosophy: Personal legend. Universe as ally in destiny.

quotes: Real leaders must be ready to sacrifice all for the freedom of their people.
A leader is like a shepherd. He stays behind the flock, letting the most nimble go out ahead.
For to be free is not merely to cast off one's chains, but to live in a way that respects the freedom of others.
I learned that courage was not the absence of fear, but the triumph over it.
No one is born hating another person. People must learn to hate, and if they can learn to hate, they can be taught to love.
Nelson Mandela.philosophy: Leadership through service. Freedom as mutual respect. Love over hate.
Nelson Mandela.technique: Nonviolent resistance. Long-term vision despite adversity.

quotes: The law of attraction is a law of nature. It is as impartial as the law of gravity.
The Secret is the law of attraction! Everything coming into your life you are attracting by the images you hold in your mind.
Be grateful for what you have now. You will be amazed at the never ending thoughts of more things to be grateful for.
The only reason why people do not have what they want is because they think more about what they don't want.
Rhonda Byrne.philosophy: Law of Attraction. Thoughts become things. Ask, believe, receive.
Rhonda Byrne.inspirations: Influenced by Wallace Wattles' 'The Science of Getting Rich'.

quotes: With the rise of the internet, the difference between you and what you want is a skill. Not luck or riches.
You're bored because you haven't developed a skill set that allows you to take on interesting challenges.
You don't need a day off when your work is what you'd be doing on your day off.
Reading without writing is like eating without lifting.
The solution to boredom is building. Build a blog. Build a brand. Build ANYTHING.
Dan Koe.philosophy: You are the niche. Holistic synthesizer approach. Skills as currency.
Dan Koe.technique: Fusing philosophy, spirituality, and business. One-person business model.
Dan Koe.inspirations: Creator economy pioneer. Distilling personal experience as life's work.

quotes: In art and dream may you proceed with abandon.
Please, no matter how we advance technologically, please don't abandon the book.
Patti Smith.philosophy: Punk poetry. Art as rebellion and freedom.

quotes: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
Everything has beauty, but not everyone sees it.
I find it surreal and exhilarating to be a poet who writes not just poems, but poets.
I like to think that the AI-powered muse will help us compose poems we can't yet write.
Repetition is really characterizing poetic language - it's about patterns and recursion.
What does it mean to be human in the nearly post-human era?
Sasha Stiles.philosophy: Poetry as technology. AI as creative collaborator. Human meaning in post-human age.
Sasha Stiles.technique: Technelegy - AI text generators fine-tuned on her writing. Poetry mentor to android BINA48.
Sasha Stiles.inspirations: Harvard/Oxford graduate. Co-founder of theVERSEverse. Prix Ars Electronica honored.
